noun.description: Such a mineral containing fluorine; especially = "fluorspar".

origin: Early 17th century (in an earlier sense). From classical Latin fluor (in medical context) morbid discharge, flux, (in general context) flow, stream (2nd cent. ad), in post-classical Latin also menstruation, mineral resembling a gem, such a mineral containing fluorine from fluere to flow + -or<br>1940s; earliest use found in British Patents. From fluor-.
